title: What are two events in history that you never would've guessed happened around the same time? - Quora

response.answer_text: The first college students around 350 BC. Jesus persecuted by Romans around 350 years later. The invention of the paperclip in 1898 and Einstein's General Relativity in 1905. The dropping of the atom bomb in 1945 and the invention of the slinky toy in 1951. 1616--Shakespeare dies, 1666 calculus developed. 1800's ---Golden era of German metaphysics, first soft drinks. 1788--Aborigines still living in a state of nature, contacted for the first time. Robert Burns writes a popular version of Auld Lang Syne. … See also: What is a real life story you experienced that is weirder than any movie plot?

1611 English explorer and sea captain Henry Hudson, his teenage son John, and six crewmen are set adrift in or near Hudson Bay, after a mutiny on his ship Discovery. They are never seen again. The Authorized King James Version of the Bible is published for the first time in London, England. 1804 Napoleon Bonaparte is proclaimed Emperor by the French Senate. Beethoven's Symphony No. 3 in E–flat premiered in Vienna. Morphine is first isolated from the opium poppy by the German pharmacist, Friedrich Sertürner.
